title: Question 14
prompt: <u>Linda jogged eleven miles through the park.  Linda jogged more miles than her sister.</u>
description: Read the underlined sentences.  Then choose the sentence that best combines those sentences into one.
feedback: In this sentence, the clause “which was more miles than her sister jogged” gives extra information. Because it’s not necessary to the main idea of the sentence, it should be set off by a comma. Placing this modifier near “park” makes the most sense and keeps the main idea of the sentence together. There is no need to put a comma before “through the park,” which is part of the main idea of the sentence.
